post_text: Good news! The Ohio Department of Health has just granted us a stadium capacity variance for our home football games. This variance allows us to utilize “green space” inside the stadium. Areas are marked off in the north endzone, northwest sideline and southwest sidelines for spectators to watch the game. Up to 4 spectators from the same household may be in these designated areas. You must provide your own seating, wear facial coverings at all times and maintain 6 ft from other families in the designated areas. We will have an additional 180 tickets for tonight's game. all spectators must be present at the time of purchase. The price is $5.00, and will be sold at the north end of the home concession stand beginning at 6:00 pm. Just a reminder that facial coverings are required at all times in the stadium and there should be no more than 4 people at the designated seating areas (which is marked by orange tape on the bleachers). Please maintain social distancing while in line to purchase tickets and enter the stadium.

post_text: Good news! We were just informed by the US Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Services as well as the Ohio Department of Education that Danville Local Schools has been approved to extend the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) that allows all students to receive a free lunch every day through December 31, 2020. This is similar to and in addition to the free breakfast for all students that will continue until further notice. We encourage all students attending school to take advantage of this as it will help reduce the financial burden on our school, community and provide consistent daily meals for all students during these continued uncertain times.
text: Good news! We were just informed by the US Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Services as well as the Ohio Department of Education that Danville Local Schools has been approved to extend the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) that allows all students to receive a free lunch every day through December 31, 2020. This is similar to and in addition to the free breakfast for all students that will continue until further notice. We encourage all students attending school to take advantage of this as it will help reduce the financial burden on our school, community and provide consistent daily meals for all students during these continued uncertain times.

post_text: Picture day for grades 7 - 12 is Wednesday, September 2. All students should plan to get their photo taken as this is important in updating PowerSchool and student records. Order forms have been sent home. Extra forms are available in the 7-12 Office. Families are encouraged to place their orders online. KCCC can get their photos taken beginning at 7 am. Remote students can get their photo taken from 8:45 - 11 am. KCCC and Remote students should enter the south entrance of the building, which is where the student gravel parking lot is located. Please contact the 7-12 Office if you have questions.

post_text:
Thank you to everyone who did their part to follow the rules and expectations of social distancing and facial coverings at this evenings football game. It is no fun, but it is worth it to see our student athletes, cheerleaders and band members have the opportunity to do what they love and have worked hard for. Everyone’s cooperation proves that we love and care about our kids and no one will be able to say we did not do our part to make this season happen and continue.
Also, thanks to everyone who paid to view the game on Blue Frame livestreaming. We had 119 paid viewers. That helps us to continue to provide the resources to support our extra curricular activities.

Thanks again for your continued support of Danville Local Schools.

post_text:
A quick note before school starts!

• All students will be required to have with them each day 2 cloth facial coverings.

• Remote learning students may pick up their Chromebooks at the Elementary Building on Friday, August 14, 8 am - 3 pm. Students will also pick up their beginning of the year forms/packet.

• HS/JH: Beginning with the first day of school, Monday, August 17, students will report to their Homerooms when they arrive each day. They can see where their Homeroom is by looking at their schedule in PowerSchool or Schoology.

post_text:
Thank you for supporting Danville Blue Devils Football!
Our “Liftathon” will be done on Saturday, July 25th.

All athletes will complete “the big three” lifts (Squat, Deadlift and Bench) at their Maximum weight possible. We are asking you to support an athlete by donating a portion depending on their performance.

We will add up the total of your athlete’s weights for their “big three” and let you know your donation amount.
(EX: 5 cents per pound if the athlete lifted a total of 600 pounds will be a $30 dollar donation)

Please fill out this form for information on the “who, what, how much” you want to donate.

Thank you in advance for your support!
GO, BLUE DEVILS!

http://www.danvilleschools.org/news/danville-football-liftathon/

post_text: Good News! As of now, all Danville students will be welcomed back to the building on August 17th per the board approved calendar. The school day will look different, but there will be support and structure for students, teachers and families. Final details will be shared after the plans are reviewed and approved by Knox Public Health and the Board of Education on July 20th. Families who wish not to return to the building will have the opportunity to continue with remote learning from home.
text: Good News! As of now, all Danville students will be welcomed back to the building on August 17th per the board approved calendar. The school day will look different, but there will be support and structure for students, teachers and families. Final details will be shared after the plans are reviewed and approved by Knox Public Health and the Board of Education on July 20th. Families who wish not to return to the building will have the opportunity to continue with remote learning from home.

Tryouts for color guard and twirlers (aka "majorettes") will be held this coming Friday, June 5th. Tryout times will be scheduled on an individual basis. For color guard, please see the video link below for the routine that you will be asked to learn. If you need a flag pole to practice with, contact Mr. Butcher.

If you are interested in joining the color guard or twirlers on the football field at next year's football games, please sign up by emailing Mr. Butcher at steve.butcher@danvilleschools.org.

Color Guard Routine Video Link: https://youtu.be/eL5esujCzfk

post_text:
Danville Local Schools Planning for 2020-21 School Year

The Danville School District is seeking input to prepare for the next school year in the event that restrictions remain in place for public schools that make it necessary to do 'schooling' differently.

It is VERY IMPORTANT that each family completes this survey in a timely manner. Some families may receive two emails (one to each parent) but need to complete the survey only ONCE PER FAMILY.

Please complete this survey on or BEFORE FRIDAY, May 29th.

It is possible 'schooling' may look differently for different grade levels/buildings. For this reason, if you have multiple children in our district you will be asked to complete certain questions for each of these children during this survey. You WILL NOT have to fill out this survey for each child you have in the district.

If you would have questions about the information in this survey, please email Mr. Jason Snively, Superintendent jason.snively@danvilleschools.org or call 740-599-6116, ext 3229

https://forms.gle/t6FLtGhfuYVPPMseA
shared_text:
DOCS.GOOGLE.COM

post_text:
Here’s a update on our building renovations.

We are updating the high school to make room for the 7th and 8th graders. This will prevent the need for students to travel and cross the road between buildings during the school day.

The abatement has been completed. Construction is planned to begin in two weeks. The abatement crew said our building is one of the best built buildings they have ever seen!
text:
Here’s a update on our building renovations.

We are updating the high school to make room for the 7th and 8th graders. This will prevent the need for students to travel and cross the road between buildings during the school day.

The abatement has been completed. Construction is planned to begin in two weeks. The abatement crew said our building is one of the best built buildings they have ever seen!

post_text:
And now for some good news ...
Art Teacher Janet Marsano is pleased to announce:
I just received notification from the Executive Director of the Ohio Governor's Youth Art Exhibition that CeCe Newbold had a piece chosen for the Top 25 Award For Excellence, This is top 25 out of the whole state of Ohio!

Attached is her self-portrait. She photocopied her face, yes, on the photocopier. She coated a 22x30 piece of paper in black charcoal and then the image was created using an eraser. CeCe is currently enrolled in KAP, the class that I teach through Kenyon. I am so proud of her!
text:
And now for some good news ...
Art Teacher Janet Marsano is pleased to announce:
I just received notification from the Executive Director of the Ohio Governor's Youth Art Exhibition that CeCe Newbold had a piece chosen for the Top 25 Award For Excellence, This is top 25 out of the whole state of Ohio!

Attached is her self-portrait. She photocopied her face, yes, on the photocopier. She coated a 22x30 piece of paper in black charcoal and then the image was created using an eraser. CeCe is currently enrolled in KAP, the class that I teach through Kenyon. I am so proud of her!

post_text: AWESOME!! 💙
shared_text:
Danville Local Schools is at Danville Local Schools.
March 23 at 2:30 PM · Danville, OH ·

Through these unprecedented times teachers continue to collaborate and prepare themselves to serve students through the use of online video communications. In the picture below, Mr. Ackert is practicing social distancing while collaborating with other teachers on utilizing online platforms and lesson management systems (LMS) to deliver curriculum to students.

The cafeteria staff and bus drivers prepared breakfast and lunch for pickup and delivered almost 100 meals to students today. This will continue until further notice.

-Superintendent, Jason Snively

post_text:
Good morning,

Tickets for the Varsity Girls Regional Game vs Fort Loramie will be on sale Tuesday- Thursday from 8AM- 3PM. Tickets will be $7 Presale and $8 at the gate. The school does keep a percentage of the presale tickets that are sold.

We are also hoping to take a pep bus to the game. The bus will leave at 3:30. Cost will be the same as Saturday, $12. That includes the ticket. We will need a minimum of 20 kids to ride the bus. JH and High School students are allowed to ride.

We are hoping to send the girls to Vandalia on a charter bus. The school will cover a portion of the bus. We are hoping for donations to cover the rest of cost for the bus. If you would like to make a donation, please do so by noon on Wednesday. Please make checks payable to Danville Athletic Boosters.

post_text:
COLLEGE CREDIT PLUS MEETING
During parent/teacher conferences on Thursday, March 19, there will be a make-up information meeting for College Credit Plus, for families who were unable to attend the first meeting in the fall. This meeting will be held from 5-6 p.m. in room 114 at the high school. Intent to Participate forms will be available to complete, which are due to the district by April 1. Please contact Mrs. Durbin at the high school with any questions you may have.

On Friday, January 17th, JV and Varsity Boys Basketball will host Mount Gilead. We will be having a Military Appreciation Night. Anyone with proper Military ID will receive free admission. We will also have a small presentation before the varsity game to thank Veterans.

JV game tips off at 6PM

post_text:
For the first time ever, Danville placed first AND second at the UC mock trial invitational. Seven students won outstanding awards, and they include Karley Ackert, Vivian Hawk (x2), Wade Mickley, Sierra Arnal, Minda Bates, Abigail Porter, and Faith Langdon. They will scrimmage Green High School on Wednesday and compete in districts next Friday.

Congratulations to all students on an outstanding performance. We're so proud of you!

post_text: Congratulations to mock trial on finishing 2nd out of 30 teams at Ohio State's first ever high school mock trial competition! This is the highest a Danville team has ever placed at a college mock trial competition (only three weeks after tying it!) Vivian Hawk, Calvin Huh, Jackson Kidwell, Karley Ackert (x2), and Adeline Lucas all won outstanding awards. On to Cincinnati!
shared_text:
Jay Nixon is with Rosemary Crunkilton Helmick and 7 others at The Ohio State University Moritz College of Law.
January 4 at 6:30 PM · Columbus, OH ·

Danville mock trial team strikes again! Team Holmes 2nd overall out of 30 teams and 6 individual awards at the OSU invitational. These kids are incredible!

post_text: The Student Council will once again be completing their Gift Wrapping service project to the Danville community. We will offer FREE gift wrapping today, Sunday 12/22, in the HS Lobby from 3:00 to 5:00 pm. Please feel free to bring any and all gifts to be wrapped and tagged by our Student Council members free of charge.

Game Times:
5:30 PM 37-older
6:30 PM 26-36
7:30 PM 25 - Younger

Danville will have 31 alumni playing
East Knox will have 23 alumni playing

50/50 Raffle

post_text:
Congratulations to our mock trial program on finishing third out of twenty-eight teams at Miami University's annual high school mock trial competition! The following students won outstanding attorney or witness awards:

Calvin Huh
Bailey Moreland
Adeline Lucas
Karley Ackert
Wade Mickley
Faith Langdon

Karley Ackert also took home the award for top witness at the entire competition.
shared_text:
Jay Nixon is with Noel Alden and 4 others.
